abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention officials announce,  for first time, recommended waiting period for couples who have been exposed to Zika virus before attempting pregnancy.
lead_paragraph: Women who have tested positive for the virus or had symptoms should wait at least eight weeks before trying to get pregnant, the agency said.

headline.main: C.D.C. Offers Guidelines for Delaying Pregnancy After Zika Exposure
headline.print_headline: C.D.C. Offers Guidelines for Delaying Pregnancy After Exposure to the Zika Virus

snippet: Women who have tested positive for the virus or had symptoms should wait at least eight weeks before trying to get pregnant, the agency said.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
